definition: to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt
to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt

sentences.english: Bell sitting on his roof, sings delightedly.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔坐在自家屋顶上乐滋滋地唱歌。

sentences.english: The actor basked in appreciative applause.
sentences.chinese: 这位演员受到热烈喝彩，心里感到乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: The Spanish dog now happily licks my hand.
sentences.chinese: 那条西班牙种的狗如今乐滋滋地在舐我的手了。

sentences.english: John smacked his lips at the prospect of going to Pairs.
sentences.chinese: 一想到要去巴黎，约翰就乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: The teacher spoke in praise of the child for his honesty.
sentences.chinese: 他受到老师的表扬心里乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: Thinking, but also review the kind of long-lost childhood delicious, heart Le Zizi's.
sentences.chinese: 想着，又可重温儿时那种久违的美味，心里乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: When I got the job, I was on cloud nine for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 得到这份工作后，我一连几周都乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: David could not take his eyes off her. Jenny saw this and was delighted.
sentences.chinese: 大卫简直目不转睛也看着她，詹尼见了心里乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: He was quite pleased to be praised by the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他受到老师的表扬心里乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: Mary has/gets stars in her eyes when she thinks of her boy friend.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽想到她的男朋友就乐滋滋的。

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
